newsitem.title: USA: IMF official sees possible further Italy rate cuts.
newsitem.headline: IMF official sees possible further Italy rate cuts.

text.p: Massimo Russo, special adviser to International Monetary Fund managing director Michel Camdessus, said on Saturday the Bank of Italy may have room to consider further interest rate cuts.

Speaking at a news conference ahead of the Group of Seven industrial nations and IMF semi-annual meetings, Russo said that Italian inflation has been reduced considerably and that the Italian central bank should bear future price data in mind in formulating monetary policy.
"I am confident that as information on inflation comes in, the central bank will take this into account in determining short-term interest rates," he said.
He said that Bank of Italy monetary policy and moderate wage agreements had led to sharp declines in Italian inflation.
Russo added that the Bank of Italy will have to consider foreign exchange rates in its monetary policy because Italy had re-joined the European exchange rate mechanism.
